title: Other News and Events
cleaned_text: Past news and events archive. Echinacea Supplements - yes or no? Echinacea, or purple coneflower, is an herb traditionally used in some Native American medicinal practices for wound healing. [See more] Echinacea purpurea and Echinacea angustifolia are two of the most common varieties used today in natural medicine for immune support. Debra G. Bell, MD, an integrative medicine family physician and co-director of education at the [...] [Read more](https://familymedicine.uw.edu/blog/should-you-take-echinacea-supplements/) Ear Seeds U.S. News talked to Gracia Tharp, LAc, lead acupuncturist at the Osher Center for Integrative Health, about ear seeding auriculotherapy. Read the article. [Read more](https://familymedicine.uw.edu/blog/ear-seeds/) How Acupuncture Can Help You Sleep Gracia Tharp, LAc, Acupuncturist with the Osher Center for Integrative Health, was interviewed for a July piece in U.S. News. Read the article, "Acupuncture for Insomnia: How Acupuncture Can Help You Sleep".
